_header: Brother abide I thee desire and pray / Abide abide…
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 284.
Title(s): The Complaint of Christ to Man ‘his Brother Natural’
_description: The Complaint of Christ to Man ‘his Brother Natural’ — twenty-eight stanzas rhyme royal

TokyoTak6.First Lines:
Brother a byde I the desire and prayA byde a byde and here thy
                    brother speke…
TokyoTak6.Last Lines:
…by side all this rewardede shalt thou beIn the blysse of
                    hevyn where ther ys no pouerte
TokyoTak6.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth a lamentable complaint of our saviour cry[st] kyng eternall
                    to sinfull mane his brother naturall
TokyoTak6.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 169-75.
